text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Qena Governorate | settlement_type = Governorate | image_flag = Governadorat de Qena flag.svg | flag_size = 120px | image_blank_emblem = Emblem Qena Governorate.jpg | blank_emblem_size = 75px | image_map = Qena in Egypt.svg | map_caption = Qena Governorate on the map of Egypt | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = | seat = Qena (capital) | leader_party = | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = | government_footnotes = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 9,565 | area_land_km2 = | area_water_km2 = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 3224000 | population_as_of = January 2018 | population_density_km2 = auto | timezone1 = EET | utc_offset1 = +2 | timezone1_DST = | utc_offset1_DST = | website = | iso_code = | calling_code = | footnotes = | image_skyline = | image_caption = A photo taken of a statue in the Qena Governorate area on December 15, 2024 }} Qena Governorate is a governorate of Egypt. The capital city is also named Qena. ==Cities== As of 2018, 9 cities had over 15,000 people. They are: *Abu Tesht *El Waqf *Dishna *Farshut *Nag Hammadi *Naqada *Qift *Qena *Qus == Qena celebrities == * Mr. Abdul Rahim Al-Kenawy. == Economy == * LG Qena. * Al-Agha Group. == Other websites == ==References== Category:Governorates of Egypt
